title: Quiz 3: Interlocutory Orders & Injunctions
description: Assess your understanding of Temporary Injunctions, Mareva Injunctions, Anton Piller Orders, and Stay of Execution.

questions.question: According to Giella v Cassman Brown, what are the conditions for granting an interlocutory injunction? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Establish a prima facie case with probability of success
Proof of fraud beyond reasonable doubt
Irreparable injury that damages cannot compensate
Balance of convenience favors the applicant
Defendant consents to the order

questions.explanation: The three pillars are: Prima facie case, Irreparable injury, and Balance of convenience.
questions.hint: This is the most famous case in Kenyan civil litigation regarding injunctions.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'Mareva Injunction'?

options.text: To seize evidence to prevent destruction
To prevent a defendant from disposing of assets to frustrate a judgment
To compel specific performance of a contract
To stop a defamatory publication

questions.explanation: Mareva injunctions freeze assets to prevent them from being removed from jurisdiction or dissipated.
questions.hint: It is often called a 'freezing order'.

questions.question: Match the Order type with its description:

pairs.right: Search and seizure of evidence (Civil Search Warrant)
Restrains a party from doing an act
Compels a party to perform a positive act
Suspends the enforcement of a judgment/decree

questions.explanation: Anton Piller = Search; Prohibitory = Stop; Mandatory = Do; Stay = Pause execution.
questions.hint: One is like a search warrant, one stops action, one forces action.

questions.question: An ex parte injunction may be granted only once for not more than ___BLANK___ days.
questions.explanation: Order 40 rule 4 limits ex parte injunctions to 14 days to prevent injustice to the unheard party.

questions.question: When seeking a Stay of Execution pending appeal (Order 42 r.6), what must the applicant prove besides substantial loss and filing without delay?
questions.explanation: The applicant must furnish such security as the court orders for the due performance of the decree.
questions.hint: What protects the winner if the loser loses the appeal but has hidden their assets?

questions.question: A court can generally grant an injunction against the Government.
questions.explanation: Under the Government Proceedings Act, injunctions generally do not issue against the Government, though modern constitutional interpretation is challenging this (e.g., conservancy orders). However, legally, the standard relief is a declaratory order.
questions.hint: Does the law allow you to stop the machinery of government easily?

questions.question: What is the 'Penal Notice' attached to an injunction order?

options.text: A notice requiring payment of a penalty
A warning that disobedience may result in imprisonment for contempt
A notice that the order is temporary
A notice to the police to effect arrest

questions.explanation: A penal notice warns the respondent of the consequences of disobedience (contempt of court/imprisonment).

questions.question: Which of the following are grounds for 'Security for Costs'? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Plaintiff resides out of jurisdiction with no property within
Plaintiff is a limited company likely unable to pay costs
Plaintiff has changed address to evade consequences
The defendant is very poor

questions.explanation: Security for costs protects the defendant. The defendant's poverty is irrelevant; the plaintiff's inability to pay or evasion is relevant.
questions.hint: It focuses on the PLAINTIFF'S ability to pay costs if they lose.

questions.question: Order the steps for obtaining an Anton Piller Order:

items.text: Demonstrate extremely strong prima facie case
Show real possibility of destruction of material

questions.explanation: These are the essential preconditions for the order, establishing the need for the element of surprise.
questions.hint: First you have a case, then harm, then evidence exists, then risk of destruction.

questions.question: Identify the incorrect statement regarding 'Appointment of Receivers'.

options.text: It is an equitable relief
It is a drastic measure taking rights away from parties
Receivers can be appointed as a mode of execution
Receivers are strictly agents of the Decree Holder

questions.explanation: Receivers are officers of the court and must act impartially, not just as agents of the Decree Holder.
questions.hint: Who does the receiver answer to primarily?
